text:
The protocol, host, and port parameters set up by HTTP Defaults are ignored by the HTTP Authorization Manager. This means that you have to specify them all over again, or more probably define them all in a User Variables and have both HTTP Defaults and HTTP Authorization refer to them via variables. This seems a little Byzantine. I expected to be able to specify host-relative URLs in the HTTP Authorization Manager but they don't work.

Note that this can be fixed without breaking existing test plans: if there is a protocol/host/port, use the entire URL, otherwise apply the defaults as required.
creator: esmond.pitt@bigpond.com

Base URL in Authorization Manager can be different from what will be specified in HTTP Request Defaults. It will usually be longer .
In my opinion this enhancement would confuse more than help and using User Defined Variables for this seems enough.
